We must restore public confidence in the Postal Service and its ability to support voting by mail during the pandemic.  We must get the Postal Board of Governors to wake up and do its job of oversight of the Postmaster General.

What leader would take steps to freeze overtime for a workforce literally risking its lives every day to deliver mail to the people of this nation ‚Äî and struggling to find enough capacity to get it done?
What leader would think that even the possibility of slowing down mail in a time of such crisis is a good idea?

In fact, Congress was told Mr. DeJoy did not yet feel prepared to respond to any questions we might have for him.

Yet he felt confident enough to freeze overtime, delay mail delivery, and propose a massive reorganization plan.

He announces these changes without engaging staff, unions, trade organizations, or Congress.

We have a Postmaster General who, six weeks into a new job ‚Äî in the midst of a global pandemic and just weeks before a contentious presidential election where the Postal Service will pay an unprecedented role ‚Äî decides to announce a sweeping reorganization.

The #PostalService is not only fighting for its economic survival, it‚Äôs fighting to maintain 120 years of professional service ‚Äî rid of this rotten patronage system that serves elected officials and not those who rely on mail delivery every day.
